definition: ideogram plus phonetic (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/also known as phonogram, phonetic compound or picto-phonetic character
to appear/to look/form/shape
sound/voice/tone/noise/reputation/classifier for sounds
phono-semantic compound character

sentences.english: Accordingly, some suggestions on pictophonetic characters teaching are made to improve teaching of Chinese as a foreign language.
sentences.chinese: 提出了對外漢字教學中有關形聲字教學的若干建議。

sentences.english: This article researches the types of error that occur when foreign students process the phonogram characters.
sentences.chinese: 本文研究外國學生在識別形聲字時產生的錯誤。

sentences.english: The significance of Dongba pictophonetic characters and its contribution to the history of written linguistics.
sentences.chinese: 納西東巴文形聲字研究對文字史研究的意義。

sentences.english: Pictophonetic characters are not phonographic, but ideographic in their word forms.
sentences.chinese: 形聲字並非表音文字，其字體結構依然遵循表義原則。

sentences.english: And therefore people created a sound law-shaped characters.
sentences.chinese: 因此又創造了形聲法來造字。

sentences.english: Studies on the source-indicating functions of phonetic complements in determinative-phonetic characters are of value to many fields of learning.
sentences.chinese: 研究形聲字聲符示源功能具有多方面的價值。

sentences.english: The Chinese characters are all most the Picto-phonetic characters in the latest ancient.
sentences.chinese: 中國文字在近古期以後，幾乎完全是形聲字。

sentences.english: Fifthly, the meaning of pictophonetic character and that of phonetic sign have no relation.
sentences.chinese: 第五種，形聲字與聲符在意義上沒有關係。

definition: transfer character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character with meanings influenced by other words/sometimes called mutually explanatory character

Six Methods of forming Chinese characters, according to Han dictionary Shuowen 說文|说文 - namely, two primary methods: 象形 (pictogram), 指事 (ideogram), two compound methods: 會意|会意 (combined ideogram), 形聲|形声 (ideogram plus phonetic), and two transfer methods: 假借 (loan), 轉注|转注 (transfer)
meaning of a character
phonetic component of a Chinese character
meaning of a word
sound and meaning
phono-semantic compound character
Guliang Annals, commentary on the Spring and Autumn Annals 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], first published during the Han Dynasty
dictionary/encyclopedia
study of classic texts, including interpretation, glossaries and commentaries
Xu Shen (-147) the compiler of the original Han dynasty dictionary Shuowen Jiezi 說文解字|说文解字[Shuo1 wen2 Jie3 zi4]
almanac
variant of 圖像|图像[tu2 xiang4]
regular script (Chinese calligraphic style)
to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
History of Zhou of the Northern Dynasties, twelfth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Linghu Defen 令狐德棻[Ling2 hu2 De2 fen1] in 636 during Tang Dynasty, 50 scrolls
